Text: What is the difference between the in keyword and the out and ref keywords?

Answers.Text: An argument passed to a parameter with the in keyword does not need to be initialized before being passed to a method.
An argument passed to a parameter with the in keyword cannot be changed by the called method.
The argument passed to the parameter with the in keyword must be initialized before being passed to the method.
The argument passed to the parameter with the in keyword can be changed by the called method.
